Package polimi.reds.broker.overlay

Interface Summary
ConnectivityChangeListener Components implementing this interface may listen for changes in the connectivity managed by some Transport, i.e., adding/removing/crashing of links.
DataListener Components implementing this interface may listen for the arrival of new data (i.e., any Serializable object) through some Transport.
Link A data link between two REDS brokers.
NeighborhoodChangeListener Components implementing this interface may listen for the event of removing existing neighbors of the local node.
Overlay As its name suggests, the Overlay is the component of a REDS broker in charge of managing the overlay network of brokers on top of which CBR is performed.
PacketListener Components implementing this interface may listen for the arrival of new packets (i.e., any Serializable object) through some Overlay.
TopologyManager The component responsible of managing the topology of a network of REDS brokers.
Transport The interface of the data-link layer of a REDS broker.
 

Class Summary
AbstractTopologyManager An abstract topology manager providing the methods common to all topology managers.
AbstractTransport  
GenericOverlay This class implements the Overlay interface by delegating most of its operations to a TopologyManager and to one or more Transports.
LinkSubstitutionInfo Contains information about a new link that has replaced another link during a reconfiguration operation.
ReconfigurationId The ID assigned by the topology manager to a reconfiguration operation.
REDSMarshaller An ObjectOutputStream that annotate classes with a codebase URL.
REDSUnmarshaller An ObjectInputStream that use the class annotations, if present, as a codebase URL to retrieve the bytecode of the objects to be unmarshalled.
SimpleTopologyManager A topology manager that does not restrict the overlay to assume any specific topology and does not try to keep the overlay connected when links/brokers die.
TCPTransport A transport using TCP to connect with neighboring brokers and standard Java serialization to marshal and unmarshal data.
 

Exception Summary
AlreadyNeighborException Thrown to indicate that the node to add as a neighbor is already a neighbor of the local node.
NotConnectedException This class represents an exception that has to be raised when a method in charge of sending data to a neighboring broker is invoked while that broker is not connected.
NotRunningException Thrown to indicate that the target object was not running.
